Param.Meaning: Pointer to version. version[0] is High 8bit and version[1] is Low 8bit.

CMD.Function: Read sc record from application..

CMD.Name: BT_GEN_READ_SC_RECORD_RES
CMD.Function: Response of read sc records indication, tell the bt stack which devices have paired. The stack will blocked until received this reponse with parameter 'more' is FALSE. When parameter 'more' is FALSE, it means that all the other parameter is invalid. in short, the response which more is FALSE is a invalid record.

Param.Name: nameLen
Param.Meaning: The length of remote device name.

CMD.Function: Indicate that new sc record.

CMD.Name: BT_GEN_REGISTER_DEVICE_INFO_REQ
CMD.Function: Issue this command to register the local device information.

Param.Name: vendorId
Param.Meaning: Identify the vendor of the device

Param.Name: productId
Param.Meaning: Product ID from the manufacturer. This is intended to distinguish between different product made by the vendor above.

Param.Name: sourceId
Param.Meaning: This attribute designates which organization assigned the VendorId attribute

Param.Name: primaryRecord
Param.Meaning: This is intended to designate one particular Device ID Service Record (in case multiple Device ID Service Records exist on a device) as the primary Device ID Service Record for the device - the PrimaryRecord attribute is set to 1 for that record and 0 for all other records.

Param.Name: clientExecutableUrl
Param.Meaning: This attribute designates which organization assigned the client executable url attribute

Param.Name: serviceDescription
Param.Meaning: This attribute designates which organization assigned the service dscription

Param.Name: documentationUrl
Param.Meaning: This attribute designates which organization assigned the documentation url

CMD.Name: BT_HFP_CALL_RING_IND
CMD.Function:
Indicate an incoming call from the remote AG device. This result code can be used by the host to generate a visual alert for the user.
If AG side supports "in-band ring tone",the AG shall send in-band ring tones.

CMD.Name: BT_HFP_CLIP_ENABLE_REQ
CMD.Function:
Send this command to enable or disbale "Calling Line Identificationnotification" function in the AG. If the "Calling Line Identificationnotification" function is enabled, "BT_HFP_INCOMING_CALL_IND"indication will be sent to application when having an incoming call.otherwise "BT_HFP_INCOMING_CALL_IND"indication won't sent to application.
The default state of "Calling Line Identificationnotification" function is enabled.

Param.Name: did
Param.Meaning: The device index of remote AG.

CMD.Name: BT_HFP_SIRI_ENABLE_CUSTOM_REQ
CMD.Function: Enable and disable custom commands related to Siri.

Param.Name: did
Param.Meaning: The device index of remote AG.

Param.Name: features
Param.Meaning: A base-10 representation of a bit field. Available features are: Bit 0 = reserved Bit 1 = The accessory supports battery reporting (reserved only for battery operated accessories). Bit 2 = The accessory is docked or powered (reserved only for battery operated accessories). Bit 3 = The accessory supports Siri status reporting. Bit 4 = the accessory supports noise reduction (NR) status reporting. Bit5~Bit15= reserved

CMD.Name: BT_HFP_SIRI_ENABLE_CUSTOM_CFM
CMD.Function: Confirm the message of BT_HFP_SIRI_ENABLE_CUSTOM_REQ and echo corresponding data to Host Application.

Param.Meaning: A base-10 representation of a bit field. Available features are: Bit 0 = reserved Bit 1 = The accessory supports battery reporting (reserved only for battery operated accessories). Bit 2 = The accessory is docked or powered (reserved only for battery operated accessories). Bit 3 = The accessory supports Siri status reporting. Bit 4 = the accessory supports noise reduction (NR) status reporting.

CMD.Function: set current folder to 'folderName', the folderName must equal one of the subfolder of current folder, otherwise this operation is invalid. you can get subfolders by BtAppMapGetFolderList.

Param.Name: flag

CMD.Name: BT_MSG_MAP_GET_MESSAGELIST_REQ
CMD.Function: This API is used for retrieving the message-listing of the folder specified by folderName.

Param.Name: mapcInstId
Param.Meaning: The value got in connection manager, current instance ID.

Param.Name: maxCount
Param.Meaning: maximum number of messages to be listed in the message listing. To retrieve the number of messages in the folder, maxcount shall be set to zero

Param.Name: offSet
Param.Meaning: offset from where to the listing should start.

Param.Name: subjectLen
Param.Meaning: The length of subject received from remote device.

Param.Name: filterPeriodBeginLen
Param.Meaning: The length of filter period begin string.

Param.Name: filterPeriodBegin
Param.Meaning: time string that may be used for filtering the messages by delivery date newer than specified. The parameter shall be formatted in "YYYYMMDDTHHMMSS", so the length of this paramter must be 15.

Param.Name: filterPeriodEndLen
Param.Meaning: The length of period end filter.

Param.Name: filterPeriodEnd
Param.Meaning: Null terminated time string that may be used for filtering the messages by delivery date older than specified. The parameter shall be formatted in "YYYYMMDDTHHMMSS", so the length of this paramter must be 15.

Param.Name: filterRecipient
Param.Meaning: recipient string. This string matches a sub-string of one of the vCard attributes "N", "TEL" and "EMAIL" of at least one <bmessage-recipient> contained by the message.

Param.Name: filterOriginator
Param.Meaning: recipient string. This string matches a sub-string of one of the vCard attributes "N", "TEL" and "EMAIL" of the <bmessage-originator> contained by the message.

Param.Name: filterPriority
Param.Meaning: Which attribute of the message in the list item you want.

CMD.Name: BT_MSG_MAP_GET_MESSAGE_REQ
CMD.Function: This API is used for retrieving a message specified by messageHandle form remote device.

Param.Name: mapcInstId
Param.Meaning: The value got in connection manager, current instance ID.

Param.Name: attachment
Param.Meaning: Whether accachment need to be deliverd

Param.Name: fractionRequest
Param.Meaning: This parameter may be used if the message is a fractioned email as applied for some push-email services and shall not be used otherwise.In this case several requests are required to retrieve the overall bMessage object. The value shall be either: 0 - when the first email fraction of the message object shall be delivered; this value shall be used by the API in its first GetMessage request on a particular bMessage or 1 - when the email fraction following the fraction of the previous GetMessage request shall be delivered by the remote device

CMD.Name: BT_MSG_MAP_PUT_MESSAGE_REQ
CMD.Function: this API is used to push messag to the phone, the message contents should be format as bmessage, and the pointer of content would be free by the library.

Param.Name: moreData

Param.Name: content
Param.Meaning: Message contents formatted bmessage which to be put this time.

Param.Name: totalMsgLen
Param.Meaning: The total length of the message.

Param.Name: transparent
Param.Meaning: This parameter may be used to indicate to the MSE that no copy of the message shall be kept in the 'Sent' folder after the message was sent.

CMD.Name: BT_MSG_AT_SUPPORT_SMS_FORMAT_REQ
CMD.Function: Query message format supported by AG. The message format can be either PDU mode (entire TP data units used) or text mode (headers and body of the messages given as separate parameters). In many cases, AG could support one or both of them, but only one mode is implemented at a time.

CMD.Name: BT_MSG_AT_GET_SUPPORT_SMS_STORAGE_REQ
CMD.Function: Indicate current parameters.

CMD.Name: BT_MSG_AT_GET_SUPPORT_SMS_STORAGE_CFM
CMD.Function: This indication used to return the result of query storage. Area <mem1> is the memory from which messages are read and deleted. Area <mem2> is the memory in which writing and sending operations are directed. Area <mem3> is the memory in which a received SMS is referred to for storage.

Param.Name: storage
Param.Meaning: bit0~bit4: mem1 storage(bit0 -> "SM", bit1 -> "ME", bit2 -> "MT", bit3 -> "BM", bit4 ->"TA") bit5~bit9: mem2 storage(bit5 -> "SM", bit6 -> "ME", bit7 -> "MT", bit8 -> "BM", bit9 ->"TA") bit10~bit14: mem3 storage(bit10 -> "SM", bit11 -> "ME", bit12 -> "MT", bit13 -> "BM", bit14 ->"TA")

Area <mem2> is the memory in which writing and sending operations are directed. Area <mem3> is the memory in which a received SMS is referred to for storage.

Param.Name: storage
Param.Meaning: bit0~bit4: mem1 storage(bit0 -> "SM", bit1 -> "ME", bit2 -> "MT", bit3 -> "BM", bit4 ->"TA") bit5~bit9: mem2 storage(bit5 -> "SM", bit6 -> "ME", bit7 -> "MT", bit8 -> "BM", bit9 ->"TA") bit10~bit14: mem3 storage(bit10 -> "SM", bit11 -> "ME", bit12 -> "MT", bit13 -> "BM", bit14 ->"TA")
